resource.meta: Shirley, R.; Roehlly, Y.; et al

For advanced queries on this catalogue use ADQL_ possibly via TAP_
.. _ADQL: /adql .. _TAP: /tap

column.name: field
column.description: Name of the field in HELP survey

column.name: help_id
column.description: HELP identifier, based on J2000 position

column.name: ra
column.description: Right Ascension (J2000)

column.name: dec
column.description: Declination (J2000)

column.name: hp_idx
column.description: HEALPix index of the source position at order 13 using the nested scheme.

column.name: ebv
column.description: Galactic extinction (Schlegel et al. 1998) at the object position

column.name: redshift
column.description: Photometric redshift obtained with EAZY.

column.name: zspec
column.description: Spectroscopic redshift collated from the literature.

column.name: zspec_qual
column.description: Spectroscopic redshift quality flag. FIXME code meaning.

column.name: zspec_association_flag
column.description: Boolean flag set to true when the association of a source to it's redshift may be problematic (possible mis-cross-association).

column.name: stellarity
column.description: Index evaluation is the source is point-source: for 0 (not point source) to 1 (point source). Generally name stellarity index.

column.name: stellarity_origin
column.description: Name of Survey from which stellarity is calculated.

column.name: f_90prime_g
column.description: Total flux density in the B band of The 90-inch prime focus camera (90prime) on The Bok Telescope.

column.name: ferr_90prime_g
column.description: Uncertainty on f_90prime_g.

column.name: f_ap_90prime_g
column.description: Aperture (nearest aperture to 2 arcsec, aperture correction applied) flux density in the B band of The 90-inch prime focus camera (90prime) on The Bok Telescope.

column.description: Uncertainty on f_ap_90prime_g.

column.name: m_90prime_g

column.name: m_ap_90prime_g

column.description: Uncertainty on m_ap_90prime_g

column.name: flag_90prime_g
column.description: Flag set to true for sources for which niether the 90prime_g aperture nor total flux should be used for SED fitting (see documentation).

column.name: flag_cigale
column.description: Flag qualifying the global fitting with CIGALE: 1 for a good fit, 0 for a bad fit, -1 if the source was not fitted.

column.name: flag_cigale_opt
column.description: Flag qualifying the fitting of the optical part of the spectrum during the global fit with CIGALE: 1 for a good fit, 0 for a bad fit, -1 if the source was not fitted.

column.name: flag_cigale_ir
column.description: Flag qualifying the fitting of the infra-red part of the spectrum during the global fit with CIGALE: 1 for a good fit, 0 for a bad fit, -1 if the source was not fitted.

column.name: flag_cigale_ironly
column.description: Flag qualifying the fitting using only infra-red data with CIGALE: 1 for a good fit, 0 for a bad fit, -1 if the source was not fitted.

column.name: flag_gaia
column.description: Flag indicating the increasing probability of the source being a Gaia object (see note).

column.name: flag_cleaned
column.description: Boolean flag denoting that the source was associated to really near object that were removed during the cleaning procedure.

column.name: flag_merged
column.description: Boolean flag denoting a possible mis-association during the cross-matching of the various catalogues.

column.name: flag_optnir_obs
column.description: Flag indicating in which wavelength regimes the source was observed (see note).

column.name: flag_optnir_det
column.description: Flag indicating in which wavelength regimes the source was detected (see note).

table.meta:
The Flag_Gaia is computed by cross-matching the catalogue with the Gaia catalogue:
+-------+---------------------------------------------------------------+ | Value | Meaning | +-------+---------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1 | The object if possibly a Gaia object: the nearest Gaia source | | | is between 1.5 arcsec and 2 arcsec. | +-------+---------------------------------------------------------------+ | 2 | The object if probably a Gaia object: the nearest Gaia source | | | is between 0.6 arcsec and 1.5 arcsec. | +-------+---------------------------------------------------------------+ | 3 | The object is definitely a Gaia object: the nearest Gaia | | | source is nearer than 0.6 arcsec. | +-------+---------------------------------------------------------------+ | 0 | Otherwise (the nearest Gaia source is farer than 2 arcsec). | +-------+---------------------------------------------------------------+

The Flag_OptNIR_Obs and Flag_OptNIR_Det are computed while cross-matching the optical and near/mid infrared catalogues and indicate if a source was observed (i.e. is on the coverage of surveys at the given regime) or detected (i.e. is present in the catalogue) in various wavelength regime. The detection is based on the detection wavelengths of the catalogues, and to be counted as detected, a source must be present in at least two catalogues.
The flag is a composed binary flag with these values:
+-------+-------------------------------------------------------------+ | Value | Meaning | +-------+-------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1 | Observation/detection in optical wavelengths. | +-------+-------------------------------------------------------------+ | 2 | Observation/detection in near-infrared wavelengths. | +-------+-------------------------------------------------------------+ | 4 | Observation/detection in mid-infrared wavelengths. | +-------+-------------------------------------------------------------+
